conclusion: To determine the speed of the elevator at t = 60 seconds, analyze the acceleration-time graph.
Identify segments of the acceleration-time graph: 0-1s linear increase, 1-4s constant, 4-5s linear decrease, 5-55s zero, 55-56s linear decrease, 56-59s constant, 59-60s linear increase.
Calculate area under curve from 0 to 1 second: Area = 1 m/s.
Calculate area under curve from 1 to 4 seconds: Area = 6 m/s.
Calculate area under curve from 4 to 5 seconds: Area = 1 m/s.
Calculate area under curve from 5 to 55 seconds: Area = 0 m/s.
Calculate area under curve from 55 to 56 seconds: Area = -1 m/s.
Calculate area under curve from 56 to 59 seconds: Area = -6 m/s.
Calculate area under curve from 59 to 60 seconds: Area = -1 m/s.
Sum the areas to find total change in velocity: Total change = 0 m/s.
The speed of the elevator at t = 60 seconds is 0 m/s.
